it.polimi.se2018.model

Class Pattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.model.Pattern
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Pattern
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The class represents a Window Pattern Card. The class is immutable, so all the attributes are final.
    Author:
    giorgiolbt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(java.lang.String name,
               int difficulty,
               Cell[][] grid)
        Constructs a Pattern with the grid passed. The matrix of Cell (grid) that represents the Pattern is instantiated somewhere else and only passed as a parameter here.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Pattern.
        difficulty - The difficulty of the Pattern. According to the Game's rules it must be between 3 and 6 otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        grid - The matrix of Cell that represents the Pattern.

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(Pattern pattern)
        Copy constructor to create a new Pattern that is the deep copy of the pattern passed as a parameter
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern that has to be copied.

    • Method Detail

        public int getDifficulty()
        Getter for the difficulty of the Pattern.

      • getGrid

        public Cell[][] getGrid()
        Getter for the grid of the Pattern. It returns a deep copy of the grid: it is necessary for the copy constructor
        Returns:
        A deep copy of the grid of the Pattern.

      • placeDie

        public Pattern placeDie(Die d,
                        Coordinates c)
                 throws PlacementErrorException
        Places the Die d at the position identified by the Coordinates c on a copy of this Pattern assuming that this placement has to respect all possible restrictions.
        Parameters:
        d - The die to be placed.
        c - The Coordinates that indicates the placement position on the Pattern's grid.
        Returns:
        A new pattern that is a copy of this, but with d placed in the correct position indicated by c.
        Throws:
        PlacementErrorException - if d is null or if the placement doesn't respect some restriction on the whole grid (at a 'global' level): If the Die d is the first Die to be placed on the grid and the Coordinates c don't indicate an edge or corner space; If the position indicated by the Coordinates c is not adjacent to a full Cell (with the exception of the first placement. This is why there is a control that verifies that the grid is not empty); If the position indicated by the Coordinates c is orthogonally adjacent to a Cell that has a Die of the same Colour or value of d. It also propagates the exception if it is thrown from Cell's place method.

      • placeDie

        public Pattern placeDie(Die die,
                        Coordinates coordinates,
                        Restriction restriction)
                 throws PlacementErrorException
        Places the Die d at the position identified by the Coordinates c on a copy of this Pattern assuming that this placement has to respect only the specified restriction restriction and the restrictions that have always to be respected (d not null and first die placement restriction).
        Parameters:
        die - The die to be placed.
        coordinates - The Coordinates that indicates the placement position on the Pattern's grid.
        restriction - The restriction that has to be respected.
        Returns:
        A new pattern that is a copy of the present one, but with d placed in the correct position indicated by c.
        Throws:
        PlacementErrorException - if the placement doesn't respect the restriction on the first Die placement (that has to be always respected) or if d is null or if the restriction specified is not respected. It also propagates the exception if it is thrown from Cell's place method.

      • moveDie

        public Pattern moveDie(Coordinates source,
                       Coordinates destination,
                       Restriction restriction)
                throws PlacementErrorException
        Move a Die from a position to another one in a Player's Pattern. This action is available only through the use of 'Eglomise Brush' and 'Copper Foil Burnisher' ToolCard. Both of them let the Player ignore value or colour restriction, so restriction indicates the restriction that has to be respected (in addition to the other placement restrictions).
        Parameters:
        source - The present position of the Die on the Pattern.
        destination - The position in which the Player wants to move the Die.
        restriction - The restriction that has to be respected.
        Returns:
        A new pattern that is a copy of the present one, but with the chosen Die that was placed in the position source in the correct position indicated by destination.
        Throws:
        PlacementErrorException - if the placement doesn't respect some restriction on the whole grid (at a 'global' level) or if d is null. It is propagated if thrown by the placeDie. It also propagates the exception if it is thrown from Cell's place method.

      • moveDice

        public Pattern moveDice(Coordinates[] sources,
                        Coordinates[] destinations,
                        Restriction restriction)
                 throws PlacementErrorException
        Move two dice from a position to another one in a Player's Pattern. This action is available only through the use of 'Lathekin' and 'Tap Wheel' ToolCard.
        Parameters:
        sources - The present positions of the dice on the Pattern.
        destinations - The positions in which the Player wants to move the dice.
        Returns:
        A new pattern that is a copy of the present one, but with the chosen dice that were placed in the positions sources in the correct positions indicated by destinations.
        Throws:
        PlacementErrorException - if the placement doesn't respect some restriction on the whole grid (at a 'global' level) or if d1 or d2 is null. It is propagated if thrown by the placeDie. It also propagates the exception if it is thrown from Cell's place method.

      • moveDice

        public Pattern moveDice(Coordinates[] sources,
                        Coordinates[] destinations)
                 throws PlacementErrorException
        Throws:
        PlacementErrorException

      • emptyCells

        public int emptyCells()
        Calculates the number of empty spaces (spaces with no placed Die) in the grid. It is useful in the end game scoring's calculus.
        Returns:
        the number of empty spaces in the Pattern's grid.
